TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit AttachmentType extends System.Object

remarks.para: The class can represent either a file or an item attachment. The class is the base type for the and the classes.

example.para: The following example shows you the use of the and the . Both of these types are derived from the class. These two types are added to the property of the class. This example also shows you the use of the in the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::AttachmentIdType ^ AttachmentId { ExchangeWebServices::AttachmentIdType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::AttachmentIdType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the attachment identifier. This property is read/write.
Docs.value: The property returns an that contains the identifier of the parent item and the attachment.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ContentId { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the attachment content identifier. This property is read/write.
Docs.value: The property returns a string that contains the content identifier.

remarks.para: The value of can be set to any string value. Applications can use the property to implement their own identification mechanism.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ContentLocation { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that corresponds to the location of the content of the attachment. This property is read-only.
Docs.value: The property returns a string that contains the URI to the content of the attachment.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ContentType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a value that describes the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type of the attachment content.
Docs.value: The property returns a string value that represents the content type of the attachment.

remarks.para: The following are some examples of strings that you can set on this property:
Note: This is not an exclusive list.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsInline { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the attachment appears inline within an item.
Docs.value: The value of the property is true if the attachment appears inline; otherwise the value is false.

remarks.para: You must set the property to true so that the property is serialized into the SOAP request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsInlineSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the SOAP request. This property is read-only.
Docs.value: The value of the property is true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the value is false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime LastModifiedTime { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets a DateTime value that specifies when the attachment was last modified.
Docs.value: The value of the property is a DateTime object.

remarks.para: You must set the property to true so that the property is serialized into the SOAP request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool LastModifiedTimeSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the SOAP request. This property is read-only.
Docs.value: The value of the property is true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the value is false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the name of the attachment.
Docs.value: The property returns a string value that represents the name of the attachment.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Size { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an integer value that represents the size in bytes of an attachment.
Docs.value: The value of the property is an integer that represents the size in bytes of the attachment.

remarks.para: You must set the property to true so that the property is serialized into the SOAP request.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SizeSpecified { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the property is serialized into the SOAP request. This property is read-only.
Docs.value: The value of the property is true if the property is serialized into the SOAP request; otherwise, the value is false.
